data.title: Creative Web Developer, APS Level 6, Questacon in ACT
data.meta_description: Creative Web Developer, APS Level 6, QuestaconQuestacon – The National Science and Technology ...
data.text:
Creative Web Developer, APS Level 6, Questacon

Questacon – The National Science and Technology Centre is a division of the Australian Government Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources. We are seeking an experienced Web Developer to join the Digital Engagement Team at Questacon.

The Digital Engagement Team has responsibility for the following key functions for Questacon:

Supporting outreach, accessibility and engagement through digital channels;

Developing content in a range of formats to excite audiences online and onsite;

Providing digital advice and support across Questacon’s systems and processes;

Providing creative leadership and practicing bold innovation in the digital space.

As an APS 6 Web Developer, you will develop, lead and manage online digital spaces and lead creative digital projects across Questacon.

In this role, you’ll ensure Questacon’s presence is of a high standard by maintaining strategic oversight for a website review and build with consideration to the broader network of digital systems.

This includes providing advice on both front and back-end applications - including Drupal 7 configuration and integrated scripts in languages such as JavaScript and PHP.

You will also maintain web applications built within a LAMP stack environment (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP). You will also provide support in administering Questacon’s internal and external facing servers.

We are seeking someone with;

A demonstrable passion for creating digital experiences which are exciting and original and a genuine desire to connect with audiences using digital technology.

A positive ‘can do’ attitude when building relationships with internal and external stakeholders and working collaboratively in a multidisciplinary digital team. This includes the ability to provide technical and non-technical support for staff.

Experience providing high-level advice on digital systems including a demonstrable ability to make decisions which support an optimised audience experience while adhering to Australian Government accessibility and privacy standards.

Experience developing high quality digital products including websites, apps and digital experiences with specific knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, Git and Adobe suites.

Experience with maintenance, development and content migration projects within Drupal environments. Experience developing in a Gov.CMS environment is essential.

Demonstrated self-awareness, problem solving, personal drive, integrity, professionalism and a proven commitment to APS Values, Code of Conduct and WHS principles.

Candidates with the below experience and qualifications will be highly regarded;

Experience in a museum or similar.

Tertiary qualification or relevant industry experience in communication, online marketing, design, programming or related field.

If you have what we are looking for and are after more information, including eligibility requirements, additional roles and responsibilities please visit our Current Vacancies page.
